text: Rolf Hochhuth (1 April 1931 â€“ 13 May 2020) was a German writer and playwright. He was best known for his 1963 drama The Deputy. His works were controversial as they talked about unpopular opinions of the Holocaust. He also defended Holocaust denier David Irving. Hochhuth was born in Eschwege, Germany.
